page.title: 11Survey of Southwick
page.content: The survey showed that there is an average of{2.8}people per house. The male/female ratio is{lOO:lO9.}The population is mostly elderly, but shows evidence of a growing young population. The oldest person has lived in Southwick for 47 years and the majority of people questioned have lived in Southwick for over l5 years. The previous residence of the people interviewed was mainly in the south of the county with many of these coming from Naval ports. Nearly all of the new houses are rented from the Council or from Mrs. Borthwick_Norton, many of these dwellings are between{2OO and {3OO years old.}The majority of the inhabitants surveyed worked within the Southwick area and are able to walk to work.
